title.narrative: OUTPUT 22: BIRTH REGISTRATION SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2022, birth registration services are more efficient for the registration of girls and boys under 5 years of age, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls and boys in Ghana, especially the most disadvantaged, increasingly benefit from an equitable and integrated child protection system.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, birth registration services are more efficient for the registration of girls and boys under 5 years of age

description.narrative: The Births and Deaths Registry conducted a number of consultations on Legislative Instrument (LI) to new Registration of Births and Deaths Act 2020 (ACT 1027). The input informed the content of the LI prior to its submission to Parliament. Ghana has made progress in linking health, civil registration and civil identity systems at the highest level. UNICEF supported the two meetings of the national CRVS committee could discuss the development and digitalization of the CRVS. Overall, infant birth registration will improve in 2021. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
